llm_answer:
Ruth’s educational ambitions:  
The records show that Ruth initially shared her sister Angeline’s desire for education; Angeline urged her to attend college, promising financial help, and Ruth did briefly return to McGrawville in 1854. However, she stayed only two months, gave up further college plans because of poor health, and instead contributed what money she could toward Angeline’s expenses.

Ruth’s emotional connection to Angeline:  
Ruth’s letters reveal a deep emotional dependence on Angeline. She wrote of being “very lonely” and said she had “never found … one so willing to share all my grief and joy,” underscoring the intimate, supportive bond between the sisters.
